page.title: 11TOURISM
page.content:
from all over the world.The quality of food served at Greywalls is renowned and has delighted many visitors including King Hussein of Jordan and Jack Nicklaus.
Dirleton Castle was built in the 13th Century by an Anglo Norman family named de Vaux. It was passed on through marriage to the Hallyburtons and finally to the Ruthvens. In the mid 17th Century it was attacked and bombarded by Cromwell's troops led by General Monk; to stop it being used again they left the castle in ruins. It is now in the care of the National Trust and is open to the public.The approx attendance per year is 25000,of which 36% are visitors from abroad, many of whom are visiting the Edinburgh Festival.
